conclusion: Analyzing how shadows change when light source moves
Blue alarm clock or timer device on the right
Egg or egg-shaped object floating near the clock
Pack of Marlboro cigarettes and a pen/cigarette on the left
Dark material in the bottom left corner
Shadow A is the shadow of the egg-shaped object
Shadow B is the shadow from the top/handle of the clock
Shadow C is the shadow from the bottom of the clock
Shadow D is the shadow from the right side of the clock
Shadows form on the opposite side of an object from the light source
Current light source appears to be coming from the upper left
Shadow A will move directly beneath the egg and become smaller
Shadow B will move directly beneath the handle and become smaller/shorter
Shadow C will shrink significantly and appear directly beneath the bottom edge
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will change as described when the light source moves
